definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The fair and impartial evaluation, also penetrating the.
sentences.chinese: 這些評價非常中肯，也都入木三分的。

sentences.english: I found myself gasping over the tragedy of the poor people's lives that the play portrayed so well.
sentences.chinese: 我不由驚歎這部戲劇對於窮人苦難生活描寫入木三分。

sentences.english: The annotation to common sensation was more than penetrating, which set people thinking.
sentences.chinese: 平實的感情詮釋，卻也入木三分，發人深省。

sentences.english: This calligrapher writes a forceful hand, with bold and vigorous strokes.
sentences.chinese: 這位書法家的書法蒼勁有力，入木三分。
他的分析真是入木三分。

sentences.english: Lao Wang's analysis was really penetrating.
sentences.chinese: 老王的分析真是入木三分。

definition: (of an actor) to bring (one's character) to life/to act brilliantly
lit. extreme saturation (idiom)/fig. vividly and thoroughly/in great detail/without restraint/(of a performance) brilliant
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
role/character in a novel/persona/also pr. [jiao3 se4]
to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement
